credentials.generateKeyPairDescription: Generate a new SSH key pair. If you want to protect the key with a passphrase, enter it in the Key Password field below first.

credentials.sshKeyGenerationNotImplemented: SSH key generation feature coming soon
credentials.credentialSecuredDescription: All sensitive data is encrypted with AES-256
credentials.securityReminderText: Never share your credentials. All data is encrypted at rest.
credentials.noHostsUsingCredential: No hosts are currently using this credential
credentials.createCredentialDescription: Create a new SSH credential for secure access
credentials.confirmRemoveFromFolder: Are you sure you want to remove "{{name}}" from folder "{{folder}}"? The credential will be moved to "Uncategorized".
credentials.failedToRemoveFromFolder: Failed to remove credential from folder
credentials.failedToMoveToFolder: Failed to move credential to folder
credentials.publicKeyNote: Public key is optional but recommended for key validation
credentials.privateKeyRequiredForGeneration: Private key is required to generate public key
credentials.generateKeyPairNote: Generate a new SSH key pair directly. This will replace any existing keys in the form.

admin.title: Admin Settings
admin.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
admin.confirmMakeAdmin: Are you sure you want to make this user an admin?
admin.confirmRemoveAdmin: Are you sure you want to remove admin privileges from this user?
admin.configureExternalProvider: Configure external identity provider for OIDC/OAuth2 authentication.
admin.deleteUser: Delete user {{username}}? This cannot be undone.
admin.masterKeyEncryptedWithDeviceFingerprint: Master key encrypted with environment fingerprint (KEK protection active)
admin.keyNotProtectedByDeviceBinding: Key not protected by environment binding (upgrade recommended)
admin.enableAes256EncryptionWithDeviceBinding: Enable AES-256 encryption with environment-bound master key protection. This creates enterprise-grade security for SSH keys, passwords, and authentication tokens.
admin.encryptExistingUnprotectedData: Encrypt existing unprotected data in your database. This process is safe and creates automatic backups.
admin.sshPrivateKeysEncryptedWithAes256: SSH private keys and passwords are encrypted with AES-256-GCM
admin.userAuthTokensProtected: User authentication tokens and 2FA secrets are protected
admin.masterKeysProtectedByDeviceFingerprint: Master encryption keys are protected by device fingerprint (KEK)
admin.keysBoundToServerInstance: Keys are bound to current server environment (migratable via environment variables)
admin.pbkdf2HkdfKeyDerivation: PBKDF2 + HKDF key derivation with 100K iterations
admin.backwardCompatibleMigration: All data remains backward compatible during migration
admin.masterKeysProtectedByDeviceBinding: Your master encryption keys are protected by environment fingerprinting. This uses server hostname, paths, and other environment info to generate protection keys. To migrate servers, set the DB_ENCRYPTION_KEY environment variable on the new server.
admin.keepEncryptionKeysSecure: Ensure data security: regularly backup your database files and server configuration. To migrate to a new server, set the DB_ENCRYPTION_KEY environment variable on the new environment, or maintain the same hostname and directory structure.
admin.testMigrationDescription: Verify that existing data can be safely migrated to encrypted format without actually modifying any data
admin.migrationInstructions: To migrate encrypted data to a new server: 1) Backup database files, 2) Set environment variable DB_ENCRYPTION_KEY="your-key" on new server, 3) Restore database files
admin.environmentProtectionDesc: Protects encryption keys based on server environment info (hostname, paths, etc.), migratable via environment variables
admin.verificationCompleted: Compatibility verification completed - no data was changed
admin.masterKeysNowProtectedByHardwareFingerpr: Master keys are now protected by real hardware fingerprinting instead of environment variables
admin.bothFieldAndFileEncryptionActive: Both field-level and file-level encryption are now active for maximum security
admin.fieldLevelAes256Encryption: Field-level AES-256 encryption for sensitive data
admin.fileLevelDatabaseEncryption: File-level database encryption with hardware binding
admin.exportDatabaseForHardwareMigration: Export database as SQLite file with decrypted data for migration to new hardware
admin.exportContainsDecryptedData: SQLite export contains decrypted data - keep secure!
admin.importDatabaseFromAnotherSystem: Import SQLite database from another system or hardware
admin.importWillReplaceExistingData: SQLite import will replace existing data - backup recommended!
admin.pleaseSelectImportFile: Please select a SQLite import file
admin.manageEncryptionAndBackups: Manage encryption keys, database security, and backup operations
admin.activeSecurityFeatures: Currently active security measures and protections
admin.backupAndRecovery: Secure backup creation and database recovery options
admin.crossSystemDataTransfer: Export and import databases across different systems
admin.exportDescription: Export SSH hosts and credentials as SQLite file
admin.importDescription: Import SQLite file with incremental merge (skips duplicates)

hosts.title: Host Manager
hosts.noHostsMessage: You haven't added any SSH hosts yet. Click "Add Host" to get started.
hosts.importJsonDesc: Upload a JSON file to bulk import multiple SSH hosts (max 100).
hosts.exportCredentialWarning: Warning: Host "{{name}}" uses credential authentication. The exported file will not include the credential data and will need to be manually reconfigured after import. Do you want to continue?
hosts.exportSensitiveDataWarning: Warning: Host "{{name}}" contains sensitive authentication data (password/SSH key). The exported file will not include this data for security reasons. You'll need to reconfigure authentication after import. Do you want to continue?
hosts.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete "{{name}}" ?
hosts.jsonMustContainHosts: JSON must contain a "hosts" array or be an array of hosts
hosts.noHostsInJson: No hosts found in JSON file

hosts.defaultPathDesc: Default directory when opening file manager for this host
hosts.sourcePortDesc: (Source refers to the Current Connection Details in the General tab)
hosts.tunnelForwardDescription: This tunnel will forward traffic from port {{sourcePort}} on the source machine (current connection details in general tab) to port {{endpointPort}} on the endpoint machine.
hosts.maxRetriesDescription: Maximum number of retry attempts for tunnel connection.
hosts.retryIntervalDescription: Time to wait between retry attempts.
hosts.autoStartDesc: Automatically start this tunnel when the container launches
hosts.sshpassRequiredDesc: For password authentication in tunnels, sshpass must be installed on the system.
hosts.debianUbuntuEquivalent: (Debian/Ubuntu) or the equivalent for your OS.
hosts.sshServerConfigDesc: For tunnel connections, the SSH server must be configured to allow port forwarding:
hosts.gatewayPortsYes: to bind remote ports to all interfaces
hosts.permitRootLoginYes: if using root user for tunneling
hosts.editSshConfig: Edit /etc/ssh/sshd_config and restart SSH: sudo systemctl restart sshd
hosts.credentialRequired: Credential is required when using credential authentication
hosts.credentialDescription: Selecting a credential will overwrite the current username and use the credential's authentication details.
